messages.author: Sarah Chen
messages.text: Heads up team - our primary HVAC vendor (CoolAir Systems) just notified me they're pushing lead times from 6 weeks to 10 weeks for all commercial units. This affects stores #Store-189 and others in our pipeline.

messages.author: Tom Wilson
messages.text: That's going to be a problem for Store-189 - we're already on a tight schedule. Can we explore the backup vendor we used for Store #189?

messages.author: Jennifer Liu
messages.text: Good idea. Store #189's backup vendor (TempMaster) came in about 15% higher on cost but delivered on time with good quality. For Store-189, that would add roughly $8K to our HVAC budget but save us 4 weeks. Let me run the numbers.

messages.author: Sarah Chen
messages.text: I can reach out to TempMaster today to confirm they can meet our timeline. The 15% premium might be worth it to avoid schedule delays.

threads.summary: Primary HVAC vendor extended lead times from 6 to 10 weeks. Team decided to switch to backup vendor despite 15% cost premium to avoid schedule delays.

messages.author: Jennifer Liu
messages.text: Good idea. Store #189's backup vendor (TempMaster) came in about 15% higher on cost but delivered on time with good quality. For Store-230, that would add roughly $8K to our HVAC budget but save us 4 weeks. Let me run the numbers.

messages.author: Mike Rodriguez
messages.text: I can reach out to TempMaster today to confirm they can meet our timeline. The 15% premium might be worth it to avoid schedule delays.

messages.author: Sarah Chen
messages.text: After running the numbers: 4-week delay would cost us ~$12K in extended fees and lost revenue. The $8K vendor premium is actually the cheaper option. Let's move forward with TempMaster.
